answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Karen – I hope the following is helpful:
DC - Pro Bono Partnerships Community Economic Development Project: Serving the Community Through Transactional Pro Bono -- http://www.dcbar.org/for_lawyers/resources/publications/washington_lawyer/june_2009/probono_partners.cfm 
Case Study Pro-Bono Project
http://blog.buildllc.com/2011/04/case-study-pro-bono-project/
Article: Architects devoted to humanitarian work are finding ways to make ends meet.
http://archrecord.construction.com/practice/Community-Service/2012/03/perspective-practice/Humanitarian-Work.asp 
American Institute of Architects: Institute Guidelines to Assist Members, Firms and Components in Undertaking Pro Bono Service Activities - http://www.aia.org/practicing/akr/AIAB090175 
Pam
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Office
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
www.transformgov.org

answers.author: Beth Rosenberg
answers.text:
You may be interested in the work of Home Aid of Northern Virginia.  This is a non-profit that coordinates with area builders who want to donate work to build and/or renovate homeless shelters and housing for homeless with local service providers who need the "building" help to be able to effectively serve vulnerable homeless persons.  I believe the Home Aid model is used in many communities

author: Karen Walz-Fuentes
text: Does your jurisdiction work with builders who are interested in providing probono (donated) services on projects such as the building/renovation of housing units for the homeless or other facilities for the public?  We are particularly interested in seeing how jurisdictions approached issues such as bonding, insurance and/or indemnification on projects.
title: Strategies for accepting probono work on public projects
